title: What Causes a Culture War? | Understanding Culture & What Shapes Our Values
description:
What causes a culture war, and what factors influence us to be attracted to one team or the other? 
To better understand this, we will draw upon some of the work of social psychologist Geert Hofstede and some of my own synthesis work in the field of cultural theology.

#culturewar #sociology #religion #theology #psychology #behavioralscience 
_____________
___________

You can pre-order my new book (release September '22) Dis-Ordered: A Christian Journey Through the Problem of Evil and Suffering at

https://linktr.ee/paulanleitner

If you find this podcast to be helpful and you want to see it continue ad-free, would you consider becoming a supporter on Patreon? Members of the Deep Talks Patreon Community receive bonus Q & A Episodes, articles, charts, discussion forums, and more.

https://www.patreon.com/deeptalkstheologypodcast

To Subscribe & Review on Apple Podcasts: https://podcasts.apple.com/us/podcast/deep-talks-exploring-theology-and-meaning-making/id1401730159

Connect with Paul Anleitner on Twitter at:

https://twitter.com/PaulAnleitner

that's not to say that you can't learn

all humans by their nature long for food

all cultures have values
embedded in these guiding stories are
values often these values are implied in

brains pick up on these salient
connections without needing them
listed off to us in a spreadsheet for
example
in broader american culture one of our

the prioritization of this value is

instead if i lit

why
the materials i've burned aren't all

the big deal is that the american flag
is a symbolic representation of the

the final ingredient are what we might

every culture has practices that

children across the country start their

in christian church context you might

and practices that reinforce the story
and values of that culture but unless

you have macro cultures like american

either there's a minimum threshold of

cultural hierarchy
another potential outcome of diverse

cultures find too much dissonance

the sharper the dissonance the more
likely this competition devolves into a

both sides vie to either retain or usurp

in an even worst case scenario the hopes

our attraction to particular sides in

personality predispositions we have and

inhabited
if you're genetically hardwired to be
